    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Kraken</h1>A kraken is an enormous, squid-like leviathan with a cruel intelligence. It hunts ships, whales, and heroes alike. The hatred and envy krakens hold for their rivals, the alghollthus, has led many krakens to make their lairs in sunken cities, where they can sift through ancient lore for long-lost arcane secrets.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Beast</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=2">Arcana</a></u>, <u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 40<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=275">Kraken</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 18</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Kraken.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Kraken.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Gargantuan" class="traitsize" title="Gargantuan">Gargantuan</span><span alt="Aquatic Trait" class="trait" title="Aquatic creatures are at home underwater. Their bludgeoning and slashing unarmed Strikes don’t take the usual –2 penalty for being underwater. Aquatic creatures can breathe water but not air."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=168">Aquatic</a></span><span alt="Beast Trait" class="trait" title="A creature similar to an animal but with an Intelligence modifier of –3 or higher is usually a beast. Unlike an animal, a beast might be able to speak and reason."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=20">Beast</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 214</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +34; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=14"><u>Aquan</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +38, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +35, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +33<br /><b>Str</b> +9, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +9, <b>Int</b> +5, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +5<hr /><b>AC</b> 42, <b>Fort</b> +35, <b>Ref</b> +28, <b>Will</b> +32<br /><b>HP</b> 360; <b>Immunities</b> controlled, emotion; <b>Resistances</b> cold 10, poison 20<br /><b>Altered Weather</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=65">evocation</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=134">primal</a>) A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rituals.aspx?ID=9"><i>control weather</i></a> ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM’s discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 10 feet, swim 40 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> arm +37 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 40 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 4d10+17 bludgeoning plus Grab</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> tentacle +37 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 60 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d10+17 bludgeoning plus Grab</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> beak +37 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 20 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d10+17 piercing</span><b>Primal Innate Spells</b> DC 40; <b>10th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=87">dominate</a></u></i> (animals only); <b>8th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=240">punishing winds</a></u></i>; <b>7th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=256">resist energy</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Constrict</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  2d10+17 bludgeoning, DC 40. On a failed save, a creature that is holding its breath loses 1d4 rounds worth of air.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Double Attack</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  The kraken makes two Strikes with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken’s multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn’t increase until after both attacks are made. If the kraken subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ink Cloud</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  The kraken emits a cloud of black, venomous ink in an 80-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside water. Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to kraken ink poison and are undetected while inside the cloud. The kraken can’t use Ink Cloud again for 2d6 rounds, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Jet</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=114"><u>move</a></u>) The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Kraken Ink</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=126"><u>poison</a></u>) Krakens are immune to this poison. <b>Saving Throw</b> DC 39 Fortitude; <b>Maximum Duration</b> 10 rounds; <b>Stage 1</b> 3d6 poison damage and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34">sickened 1</a> (1 round); <b>Stage 2</b> 4d6 poison damage and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=34">sickened 2</a> (1 round).</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Locations" title="Sidebar - Locations" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_3_Locations.png"> Kraken Locations</h3>A kraken dwells in deep ocean trenches, sunken cities, or caves and reefs near hydrothermal vents. It seeks food near the surface, however, where it can prey on seagoing vessels.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Kraken Treasure</h3>A kraken’s hoard includes the plunder of ships lost at sea and the wealth of sunken cities. Virtually anything could be found in a kraken lair, but they especially covet scrolls, spell books, and other tomes of ancient lore, as well as gemstones and rarefied raw materials found only in the ocean depths.</span>

                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
